data.title: NeueHouse 10x10 House Party
data.meta_description: As they mark ten years of NeueHouse Madison Square, join them for a house-wide House Party celebrating their members: the artists, entrepreneurs, and change-makers across industries whose creative force shapes […]
data.text:
As they mark ten years of NeueHouse Madison Square, join them for a house-wide House Party celebrating their members: the artists, entrepreneurs, and change-makers across industries whose creative force shapes our community.

Powered by Lucid, NeueHouse Madison Square will transform into an immersive artistic space. Activations across multiple floors will showcase creative expression in music, art, dance, and film, with live performances, and culinary delights throughout the evening.

With Special Guests

STEFANIE BATTEN BLAND

2023 Creative Capital Awardee, Stefanie Batten Bland was destined for a future in the arts. The child of a jazz composer/producer father and writer mother and raised in Soho when it was still led by artists, Batten Bland exhibits a unique blend of African American flamboyance and European sensibility.

JUAN MIGUEL MARIN

Ecuadorian multi-disciplinary artist who’s work explores the relationship between memory, sound, and emotion. In his pieces, the unconscious plays a crucial role, like a guide that reveals a road which can only be seen once it has been traveled in its entirety.

SAVINIEN CARACOSTEA

Designer and cultural entrepreneur based in NYC. Trained as an architect at the Harvard Graduate School of Design, his research focused on AR-enhanced retail and hospitality. He is a partner of TETATET, a creative and narrative strategy bureau working and consulting for prestigious fashion brands, hospitality groups and universities. In 2021, he co-founded the META Foundation, which connects the physical and virtual space to bring economical opportunities to communities worldwide.

KATINI YAMAOKA

Japanese-African singer-songwriter from New York, Katini Yamaoka, blends her diverse cultural influences into soulful music. Her EP “Beautiful Tragedy” reflects a vibrant fusion of Asian and African sounds. Beyond music, she founded Katini Skin, a natural skincare brand. Committed to human rights, she performs for the United Nations Australia and serves on the board of Black Progress Matters, promoting diversity and inclusivity.

DJ MOJOXOJOJO

Jojo a NYC native, is an open format DJ with west african roots. Specializing in variety of genres including Afrobeats, afrohouse, Amapiano, Hip Hop/R&B and soulful House remixing, she is known for her flawless mixing/mashing of classics with experimental sounds. Jojo’s aim is to be able to evoke emotions and tell a story through musical expression, spreading messages of love, freedom, happiness and peace through sound.
